result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Joyce Kay Playter was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay fine/costs of $3264.00.  Under the IDIP program, pay $1744.00 with $1520.00 stayed.  To be paid in installments of $100.00 per month commencing 01-01-2017 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full.

Sentenced to 125 days in the Pepin County Jail.  Under the IDIP Program, defendant to serve 60 days jail with 65 days stayed.  Jail sentence to commence immediately.  After serving the first 48 hours without release, work release privileges granted.  Credit for 2 days
Operating privileges revoked for 30 months.  Under the IDIP program, operating privileges revoked for 24 months with 6 months stayed.  Credit for any administrative suspension.
Submit to and comply with an alcohol assessment by the approved public treatment facility and comply with the development of a driver safety plan.
Court finds defendant eligible for the IDIP Program.   Failure to comply with the program will result in all stays of the sentence to be lifted.

Letter from Chambers of Circuit Judge advising Joyce Playter successfully completed the IDIP program.
Letter from Chambers of Circuit Judge to Joyce Playter re: nearing completion of the IDIP contract.
Defendant Joyce Kay Playter in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of IDIP Program and missed tests.
Review hearing on August 22, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

IDIP Agreement:
IDIP Program Requirements:  1)Length of IDIP Agreement.  2)Absolute Sobriety.  3)Monitored Sobriety.  4)AODA Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.  5)Payment of IDIP Program Fee.  6)Community Service Work.  7)No violations of law.  8)Other conditions.  9)Violations of the agreement.
Letter to Pepin County Sheriff advising defendant has been approved for participation in the IDIP Program, enclosed is a copy of the signed agreement.
Letter to IDIP Coordinator with the draft IDIP Agreement and JOC as Joyce Playter has been approved to participate in the IDIP Program.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Affidavit in Support of Order for IID Exemption

Defendant Joyce Kay Playter in court with attorney Jessie Gwynn Weber.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Criminal complaint amended from 4th to 3rd offense.  Court advises of charges/max. penalties and rights.  Agreement reached, defendant will plead to OWI 3rd, all other charges, citations will be dismissed, refusal reasonable, IDIP under guidelines.  Defendant pleads guilty, found guilty.  Dismiss 15TR579, 15TR600 found reasonable, dismiss count 2 of 15CF53.  Sentence full penalties stated, find IDIP eligible, fine, jail reduced under IDIP contract, 2 days sentence credit.
Initial appearance at 04-19-2016 02:30 pm
Adjourned initial appearance at 04-19-2016 02:30 pm

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joyce Kay Playter in court with attorney Jessie Gwynn Weber.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charge/max. penalties. Defendant waives TL for PH.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance at 01-05-2016 01:30 pm
15R 001584.  Rec'd from GPS bond posted of $1000 by credit card with GPS on 12/7/15.
Defendant posted $1000 bond by credit card with GPS.

Defendant Joyce Kay Playter in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charges/max. penalties and rights, felony prohibitions, right to preliminary hearing within 10 days if in custody, 20 days if not.  State requests $1000 cash bond or alcohol monitoring, no operation motor vehicle w/o valid license, or court consider alcohol monitoring.  Defendant informs court prepared to pay the $1000.  Court sets $1000 cash bond with additional conditions:  no drinking; no operation motor vehicle w/o valid license or insurance or defendant may be released on twice a day alcohol monitoring.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
